name: Skeleton Words 7 Quiz | Word Play | 25 Questions

questions.text: GST (a month of the year)
GL (a dome-shaped Eskimo house)
MSQT (the female of this insect has a long proboscis adapted for piercing the skin of man and animals to suck their blood)
PSN (any substance that can impair function, cause structural damage or injure the body)
RMDLL (animal with a covering of strong horny plates over most of its body)
Y (the organ of sight)
STR (landlocked republic in central Europe)
L (European freshwater fish with a long snakelike body)
NTQ (any decorative object made in earlier times collected and valued for its beauty, workmanship and age)
S (freedom from discomfort, worry or anxiety)
FRKNS (an official language of all the Republic of South Africa)
RBCS (any system of sustained exercises designed to increase the amount of oxygen in the blood and strengthen the heart and lungs)
SHWN (North American Indian people)
PRMNT (of the greatest importance or significance)
L (any plant chiefly native to southern Africa with fleshy spiny-toothed leaves and red or yellow flowers)
TP (any real or imaginary society considered to be perfect or ideal)
ZL (an archaic name for the European blackbird)
R (an elaborate accompanied song for solo voice from a cantata, opera or oratorio)
GL (a large juicy, yellow-skinned citrus fruit of the West Indies)
questions.explanation:
ugli.

	A cross between a tangerine, grapefruit and orange.

questions.text: NC (one of the five classical orders of architecture characterized by fluted columns)
questions.explanation:
ionic.

	The other orders are Doric, Composite, Tuscan and Corinthian.

questions.text: N (a member of the aboriginal people of Japan)
NGM (a person, thing or situation that is mysterious, puzzling or ambiguous)
CHN (a German city)
DM (an excessive accumulation of serous fluid in the tissues of the human body)
SMR (an African capital city)
questions.explanation:
asmara.

	The capital of Eritrea. Hope you enjoyed the quiz.
